hackathon-description-text: MakeMIT is back for its 5th year! With lots of materials, plenty of space, and passionate hackers, MakeMIT is a full-day hardware hackathon taking place on February 24, 2018. With many sponsors and mentors, hackers should have no problem making their dreams come true no matter how challenging the ideas may be.

hackathon-judges.judge-name: Sponsors, Mentors, and Organizing Team Members

hackathon-rules: Rules can be found at: https://makemit.org/

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: Nintendo Switch 32GB Console Neon RedNeon Blue JoyCon
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: NVIDIA - Best use of the NVIDIA Jetson TX2 Developer Kit

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: Up to 4 Surface Pro’s and Keyboards (one for each member of the winning team).
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Microsoft - Best Use of Microsoft Technology

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: 3 Google Home Mini's, 1 Fitbit Charge 2 - Black Silver - Large, 1 Bose Soundlink Micro - Black (shared among the team members)
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Verizon - Best Use of Data Science

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: 2 Google Home Mini's, 2 Beats Powerbeats3 wireless earphones, 1 Bose SoundSport wireless headphones (shared among the team members)
Prize: iRobot Create 2 (one for each member of the winning team)

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Particle - Most Creative IoT Problem Solver

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $250 in cloud computing credit for Paperspace.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Paperspace - Best Use of Machine Learning
SOLIDWORKS - Form-Fit Function Design Appreciation Award

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: Each member of the winning team will be given an Ultimaker t-shirt, a spool of Ultimaker engineering filament of their choice (valued at $50-$100), and one of the last remaining sets of the Design Engine Starter Pack design inspiration game.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=84 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: MakeMIT uses Gavel to identify the top 7 projects. Gavel was developed in-house for HackMIT and is used for many hackathons.
Sponsored prizes will be awarded by company representatives.
After narrowing projects to the top 10, a panel of judges will be choosing the top 3 projects.

hackathon-description-header: MakeMIT is the world's premiere hardware hackathon! With 16 hours and a plethora of hardware, over 300 hackers compete for the greatest hack!
